entries.title: Ticket
entries.definition: A record of a customer inquiry, issue, or request in HubSpot Service Hub. Tickets track the entire support interaction from creation to resolution, including all communications and notes.

entries.title: Ticket Status - New
entries.definition: A newly created ticket that has not yet been reviewed or assigned. New tickets should be triaged quickly to meet SLA requirements.

entries.title: Ticket Status - Waiting on Contact
entries.definition: The support team has responded and is awaiting a reply from the customer. The ticket is not actively being worked until the customer responds.

entries.title: Ticket Status - Waiting on Us
entries.definition: The ticket requires action from the support team. The customer is waiting for a response or resolution. These tickets should be prioritized to meet response SLAs.

entries.title: Ticket Status - Closed
entries.definition: The ticket has been resolved and the issue is considered complete. Closed tickets are used for reporting on resolution time and support team performance.

entries.title: Ticket Priority
entries.definition:
The urgency level of a support ticket:

  • Low - General inquiry, no immediate impact
  • Medium - Issue affecting workflow
  • High - Significant business impact
  • Urgent - Critical system down

entries.title: Service Level Agreement
entries.definition: A commitment to respond to or resolve tickets within a specified timeframe. HubSpot Service Hub tracks SLA status and alerts teams when tickets are approaching or past due.

entries.title: Knowledge Base
entries.definition: A self-service library of articles, guides, and FAQs that customers can access to find answers without contacting support. Reduces ticket volume and improves customer satisfaction.
